item.title: 野村将调查印度债券部是否虚增利润
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，野村控股公司正在调查其印度固定收益业务，要求其利率部门的高级官员确定近年来是否存在利润虚增的情况。【原文：Nomura Holdings Inc. is investigating its India fixed-income business, asking senior officials in its rates division to determine whether profits were inflated in recent years, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: KKR 为钱德拉-阿斯利的埃索交易提供 7.5 亿美元融资
item.description: KKR & Co. 将为 Chandra Asri 集团提供 7.5 亿美元，用于收购埃克森美孚公司在新加坡的埃索品牌零售加油站。【原文：KKR & Co. is providing Chandra Asri Group with $750 million for its acquisition of Exxon Mobil Corp.’s Esso-branded retail fuel stations in Singapore.】

item.title: 在新五年计划的支持下，中国大力发展绿色氢能
item.description: 尽管绿色氢能在重排放行业的去碳化过程中发挥着核心作用，但该行业一直举步维艰，在中国政府发出继续支持绿色氢能的信号后，中国正在提高绿色氢能的产能。【原文：China is ramping up green hydrogen capacity after Beijing signaled its continued support for a sector that has struggled, despite its central role in decarbonizing emissions-heavy industries.】

item.title: 市场等待延迟的美国数据，金属走低
item.description: 基本金属走低，因为投资者在等待因政府关门而推迟发布的一系列美国经济数据。【原文：Base metals edged lower as investors waited for a bundle of US economic data that’s been delayed by the government shutdown.】

item.title: 鲨鱼宝宝 "如何将粉红女郎推向股市
item.description: 近十年前，"鲨鱼宝宝之舞 "在全球范围内广为流传，但这首病毒式广告歌在YouTube上的点击量已超过160亿次，至今仍是互联网上最具辨识度的儿童娱乐作品之一。【原文：“Baby Shark Dance” became a global earworm almost a decade ago, but the viral jingle — which has racked up more than 16 billion views on YouTube — still ranks among the internet’s most recognizable pieces of children’s entertainment.】

item.title: 泰国第三季度国内生产总值不及预期，仅增长 1.2
item.description: 受工厂产出和外国游客人数减少的影响，泰国上一季度的经济放缓程度超出预期。【原文：Thailand’s economy slowed more than expected last quarter, hurt by softer factory output and foreign tourist arrivals.】

item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 孟加拉国准备对被推翻的流亡领导人作出判决
item.description: 孟加拉国的一个特别法庭预计将于周一就被推翻的领导人谢赫-哈西娜（Sheikh Hasina）是否因其在去年对学生领导的抗议活动的致命镇压中所扮演的角色而犯有反人类罪做出裁决。【原文：A special tribunal in Bangladesh is expected to rule Monday on whether ousted leader Sheikh Hasina is guilty of crimes against humanity for her role in the deadly crackdown of student-led protests last year.】

item.title: CD&R 公司接近收购气泡袋制造商希悦尔公司
item.description: 知情人士透露，Clayton Dubilier & Rice 公司即将收购希悦尔公司（Sealed Air Corp.【原文：Clayton Dubilier & Rice is nearing an acquisition of Sealed Air Corp., the packaging company behind Bubble Wrap, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行董事会成员支持以灵活方式实现价格和就业目标
item.description: 澳大利亚储备银行董事会成员蕾妮-弗莱-麦基宾（Renee Fry-McKibbin）在《澳大利亚金融评论》（Australian Financial Review）的一篇专栏中写道，澳大利亚储备银行以灵活的方式执行其维持就业和抑制通胀的双重任务，这是对近期评论的回击。【原文：The Reserve Bank of Australia pursues a flexible approach to its dual mandate of sustaining employment and reining in inflation, board member Renee Fry-McKibbin wrote in a column in the Australian Financial Review that pushed back at recent commentary.】

item.title: 人工智能初创公司图灵获得电装公司 3.88 亿美元的支持
item.description: 日本自动驾驶技术初创公司图灵公司从丰田汽车公司（Toyota Motor Corp.【原文：Japanese self-driving tech startup Turing Inc. raised about ¥15.3 billion ($99 million) from investors including Toyota Motor Corp. supplier Denso Corp., underscoring growing interest in the company’s artificial intelligence technology.】

item.title: 财政忧虑重现，高盛认为日本债券溢价上升
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc. ）认为，随着投资者对规模超过预期的经济刺激计划日益警惕，日本的财政风险溢价将会回归，从而给期限较长的主权债券和日元带来压力。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. sees a return of Japan’s fiscal risk premium as investors grow wary of a larger-than-expected stimulus package, putting pressure on longer-maturity sovereign bonds and the yen.】

item.title: 中央银行避免外汇操纵，台币升值
item.description: 在台湾中央银行与美国政府达成协议，承诺避免操纵汇率后，台币汇率创下近三周以来的最大涨幅。【原文：The Taiwan dollar climbed the most in nearly three weeks after the island’s central bank pledged to avoid manipulating exchange rates in an agreement with the US government.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚政府称，印尼计划将自由浮动水平提高 25%，以深化市场
item.description: 印度尼西亚计划逐步提高上市公司的最低自由流通量水平，作为其深化股市流动性和吸引更多投资者努力的一部分。【原文：Indonesia plans to gradually increase the minimum free-float level for listed companies as part of its effort to deepen stock market liquidity and attract more investors.】

item.title: 印度首富认为谷歌将带来价值 1 万亿美元的经济繁荣
item.description: 大约三十年前，当 N. 钱德拉巴布-奈杜（N. Chandrababu Naidu）试图将印度南部打造成全球科技中心时，他经常遇到投资者的怀疑。【原文：Some three decades ago, when N. Chandrababu Naidu was seeking to turn southern India into a global tech hub, he regularly encountered skepticism from investors.】

item.title: 干预措施增加了分析师的观点，韩元前景有所改善
item.description: 押注韩元反弹的投资者从韩国当局的最新干预措施中获得了新的支持，加强了对更强劲的增长前景和美联储潜在的宽松政策将阻止韩元进一步下跌的预期。【原文：Investors betting on a won rebound drew fresh support from Korean authorities’ latest intervention, reinforcing expectations that stronger growth prospects and potential Federal Reserve easing will stem further losses.】

item.title: 中国发出旅游警告后日本旅游股下跌，研究报告
item.description: 周一，日本旅游业和与旅游相关的股票大跌，此前中国政府警告其公民不要前往日本旅游和留学，两国之间的外交争执不断加深。【原文：Japanese tourism and travel-related stocks slumped Monday after Beijing warned its citizens against traveling to and studying in Japan amid a deepening diplomatic spat between the nations.】

item.title: 英国预算案公布前数百万英镑房屋销售额大幅下降
item.description: 最新数据显示，10 月份英国最昂贵住宅的销售量大幅下滑，富裕买家似乎对工党即将发布的预算案中所谓的豪宅税前景望而却步。【原文：Sales of the UK’s most expensive homes plummeted in October, according to new data, with affluent buyers appearing to be put off by the prospect of a so-called mansion tax in Labour’s upcoming budget.】

item.title: 日本国内生产总值（GDP）缩水，支持田中一郎的财政刺激主张
item.description: 日本经济六个季度以来首次出现萎缩，为首相高市真奈提出的雄心勃勃的经济刺激计划提供了支持。【原文：Japan’s economy contracted for the first time in six quarters, supporting Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s case to compile an ambitious economic stimulus package.】

item.title: 新西兰人口增长缓慢阻碍经济复苏
item.description: 除大流行病外，新西兰的人口增长速度是近 13 年来最慢的，这进一步阻碍了新西兰疲软的经济复苏。【原文：New Zealand’s population is growing at the slowest pace in nearly 13 years, excluding the pandemic, further hampering its sluggish economic recovery.】

item.title: 俄罗斯新罗西斯克港恢复运营，石油价格下跌
item.description: 有迹象表明，俄罗斯黑海重要港口新罗西斯克的活动已经恢复，在此之前，乌克兰上周的罢工造成了一些损失并暂停了运营，石油随之下跌。【原文：Oil dropped following signs that activity had resumed at the key Russian port of Novorossiysk on the Black Sea, after a Ukrainian strike last week led to some damage and a suspension of operations.】

item.title: 降息押注减少，黄金连跌两日后回升
item.description: 受美国联邦储备委员会（US Federal Reserve）下月降息的乐观情绪减弱的刺激，黄金走高，止住了连续两天的跌势。【原文：Gold edged higher, halting two days of losses spurred by fading optimism the US Federal Reserve will cut interest rates next month.】

item.title: 香港学生宿舍吸引私募股权投资，投资额达 4.12 亿美元
item.description: 这就是私募股权巨头在房地产峰会上大肆宣扬的东西，也是代理商向客户推销的东西；不是购物中心，不是数据中心，而是学生宿舍。【原文：It’s what private equity giants tout at property summits and agents pitch to clients — not shopping malls, not data centers, but student dormitories.】

item.title: EQT 亿万富翁大举进军亚洲，向华尔街巨头发起挑战
item.description: 亿万富翁投资人让-埃里克-萨拉塔（Jean Eric Salata）首次进军亚洲的经历十分痛苦：在印度五次注销，损失不断增加，价值数亿美元。由于日子过得太艰难，他把自己的电脑密码改成了 "坚持不懈"，每天提醒自己要坚持下去。【原文：Billionaire investor Jean Eric Salata’s first foray into Asia was painful: Five write-offs in India and mounting losses worth hundreds of millions of dollars. Times were so tough, he changed his computer password to “perseverance” as a daily reminder to keep going.】

item.title: 智利共产党人和保守派在通往总统决选的路上
item.description: 智利共产主义者珍妮特-哈拉（Jeannette Jara）和保守派人士何塞-安东尼奥-卡斯特（José Antonio Kast）似乎将在下个月的总统竞选中决出胜负。【原文：Chilean communist Jeannette Jara and arch-conservative José Antonio Kast appear to be headed to next month’s presidential runoff that will spotlight starkly divergent views on how to lead one of Latin America’s richest economies.】

item.title: 数据延迟发布，亚洲开盘后走势低迷：市场综述
item.description: 在美联储政策路径的不确定性挥之不去的情况下，投资者为一系列美国经济数据做好了准备，亚洲市场的开局显得谨慎。比特币抹去了今年的涨幅。【原文：Asian markets look set for a cautious start as investors brace for a barrage of US economic data amid lingering uncertainty over the Federal Reserve’s policy path. Bitcoin erased its gains for the year.】

item.description: 由美国华平投资集团（Warburg Pincus）支持的亚洲数据中心运营商普林斯顿数字集团（Princeton Digital Group）计划投资 7 亿美元建设其在韩国的首个园区，以推动该国的人工智能发展。【原文：Princeton Digital Group, a data center operator in Asia backed by Warburg Pincus, plans to invest $700 million in its first South Korean campus to power artificial intelligence development in the country.】
